Introduction

Oh Jong Hyuk is a South Korean singer, actor, and television personality best known for his role as a former member of the popular first-generation K-pop group Click-B under DSP Media. Born on February 16, 1983, he debuted in 1999 as a vocalist for the group, which gained significant attention for their blend of pop and rock elements.

Following Click-B's initial disbandment in 2002, Oh Jong Hyuk embarked on a successful solo career, releasing multiple albums and showcasing his vocal versatility. Beyond music, he expanded his talents into acting, appearing in dramas, musicals, and variety shows, further solidifying his presence in the entertainment industry. Known for his dedication to his craft, he has remained a beloved figure among fans and continues to influence the evolving landscape of Korean pop culture.
